description: The Mayors Fest rock show opens on 4 April and aims to raise money for three local charities.
title: Wolverhampton's annual mayor's rock charity festival returns
title_page: Wolverhampton's annual mayor's rock charity festival returns - BBC News
maintext:
Rock fans are being asked to support a three-day charity rock music festival which returns to Wolverhampton in April.
The annual Mayors Fest supports local charities chosen by the city's mayor, with last year's event raising more than Â£6,000.
Organisations set to receive funds this year include the Beacon Centre, Age UK Wolverhampton and The Samaritans Wolverhampton.
The Mayor of Wolverhampton, Councillor Linda Leach, said: "If you like your music live and loud then please come along and have a great time."
